intro: Microstylis rotundata, commonly known as the round-leaved microstylis, is a small herbaceous plant native to the wetlands of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces tiny, clustered flower heads that are typically green or brown in color. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in marshy areas or along the edges of ponds. Due to its delicate structure and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
